alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 9:38PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lincoln, southeastern Stevens and northwestern Spokane Counties through 1015 PM PDT... At 938 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Airway Heights, or 7 miles southwest of Spokane, moving northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spokane, Spokane Valley, Airway Heights, Nine Mile Falls, Millwood, Fairwood, Country Homes, Suncrest, Town And Country, Fairchild AFB, Mead, Reardan, Marshall, Clayton, Tum Tum, and Deep Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 271 and 286. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 265 and 297. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 93 and 95. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 165 and 173, and between mile markers 185 and 187. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
